@jalil +1 on making channels permissionless legos (enshrined on the protocol)

but we're still a few iterations away in finding PMF for channels. we've been working with 300+ channel mods to help them manage and grow their channels with tools like @curabot. Merkle's been adding whatever functionality/API we've requested for channels so far. my guess is once we find PMF, we should have a good idea of what/how to enshrine on protocol.

great piece on communities, trust and tokens.

"the most surprising take comes from the memecoin space. The most active and engaged crypto communities aren‚Äôt necessarily those with the most sophisticated governance models‚Äîthey‚Äôre the ones that have created an identity people resonate with. Memecoins work because they tap into an emotional layer of belonging, humor, and shared experience."

excited to chat about using farcaster channels as a building block for onchain communities.

thanks to @nounishprof and @adrienne for hosting talks with channel mods and community builders on farcaster this thursday and friday!
